learnings.lesson: fill the form, and click on the right sign in button, there can be multiple sign in buttons one for navigating to sign in page and another for submitting the sign in form
the sign in button is in class css-1s1r74k
sign in button data-automation-id="signInSubmitButton" class css-1ru62dj area-hidden="true"

domain_knowledge.first action: accept cookies pop-up if present, to avoid blocking further actions.
domain_knowledge.second action: if a login/ sign in prompt appears, log in/sign in  using stored credentials before proceeding., prefer sign in over sign up/ create account
domain_knowledge.page analysis: analyse complete page at one go and try to fill everything and click next for the first iteration itself, if issue arise then do it step by step for the once where issues arrise
domain_knowledge.skill_selectors: For searchable skill dropdowns: type ONE skill, wait 1 sec, click suggestion. Repeat for each skill.
domain_knowledge.file_uploads: ALWAYS verify file upload: after send_keys(), check if value attribute is set. Print confirmation.
domain_knowledge.multi_select: Add items one by one: type, wait, select, repeat. Never paste comma-separated list.
domain_knowledge.button_clicks: If normal click fails with 'element click intercepted', use JavaScript click: driver.execute_script('arguments[0].click();', element)
domain_knowledge.sign in button: If multiple 'Sign In' buttons are present, identify the correct one by checking its context (e.g., within a login form) before clicking.
domain_knowledge.modal dialogs: Always check for modal dialogs after page loads or actions. If present, handle them (e.g., close or accept) before proceeding.
